description: From Latin ēlīminātus, past participle of ēlīmināre (“to turn out of doors, banish”), from ē (“out”) + līmen (“a threshold”), akin to līmes (“a boundary”); see English limit and limen.

verbs.description: eliminate (third-person singular simple present eliminates, present participle eliminating, simple past and past participle eliminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To completely remove, get rid of, put an end to.
examples: Synonyms: abrogate, abolish; see also Thesaurus:destroy

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang) To kill (a person or animal).
examples: a ruthless mobster who eliminated his enemies

entries.meaning: (transitive) To exclude (from investigation or from further competition).
examples: Bill was eliminated as a suspect when the police interviewed witnesses.
John was eliminated as a contestant when it was found he had gained, rather than lost, weight.

entries.meaning: (accounting) To record amounts in a consolidation statement to remove the effects of inter-company transactions.
